topic.title: War Memorial Hall
topic.shortdesc: My thoughts on War Memorial Hall

section.title: History of the Building
section.p: War Memorial Hall originally finished construction in 1926. The building was funded by an alumni campaign to finance a building to memorialize Hokies who died fighting in World War I. The building has been significantly renovated multiple times, including from 1972 to 1975. Most recently, in Fall 2024, War Memorial finally reopened after two years of renovations.

section.title: What I Like About the Building
section.p: The recent reopening of War Memorial Hall has inspired me to actually start going to the gym this semester. It is so much closer to my dorm than McComas, and by having two gyms on campus, neither of them are as busy as McComas was before (from what I'd heard).

The gym itself is also really good. There is a fantastic selection of different machines, and a solid number of each. From my experience, most of the machines are simple and easy to use, and there are also staff there that you could ask for help with anything if you need it.

section.title: What I Dislike About the Building
section.p: The gym took me a few minutes to find the first time I went there, but that isn't an issue long-term. I do wish the gym was closer to the entrance, but that is also a rather small complaint.

I wish there were more treadmills. Everything else there always has a few open machines (at least when I go), but sometimes there isn't an open treadmill. There are already a lot of them, but considering their popularity I still wish there were more.
